alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 04 at 8:06PM EDT until October 05 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...A high risk for rip currents. * WHERE...The Atlantic beaches of Eastern Currituck County including the Northern Outer Banks * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. COROLLA NC MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.5 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 05/04 AM 4.1 0.4 0.9 1 NONE 05/04 PM 4.9 1.2 0.9 1 NONE 06/05 AM 4.1 0.4 0.6 1 NONE 06/05 PM 4.4 0.7 0.4 1 NONE 07/06 AM 3.7 0.0 -0.1 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
